scenarioDescription:
The HD 23596 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 23596 is a star with 1.47 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.53 times its radius. It is located 169.61 light years away from the solar system.

HD 23596 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 23596 system


HD 23596 b

HD 23596 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2003-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.77 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 23596 b is 2871.540 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 23596 b is 12.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 23596 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 23596, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 23596 - System With 1 Exoplanet
